data.title: [jade] Syntax highlighting in attribute values not correct
data.body:
### VS Code version:

0.10.8
### Code:

```
block content
  div(style='width:30vw')
    h1= title
    p= location
    p This is a paragraph
    img(src= image)
```
### Description:

The `image`-variable isn't highlighted corrctly.In fact all attribute-value-variables inside a html element, not only for the `img`-Tag are not highlighted correctly. This happens with all Themes and also with disabled extensions.
`image` should be white instead of grey.
### Image:

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1260620/13502000/48b0e15c-e169-11e5-8ffd-9c2b86d3c883.PNG)
### For comparison the same Syntax highlighted in another Editor (Sublime):

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1260620/13502072/ac1e5116-e169-11e5-873e-ab7fce69797c.png)

data.title: Intellisense Javascript for simple classes
Add support for internal links in previewHtml
Debug adapter can't enable ExceptionBreakpointFilters by default
data.body:
Because of some recent changes now debug adapter must provide default ExceptionBreakpointFilters, however there seems to be no way to enabled some or all of these filters by default. It's kind of unexpected for user that the "Unhandled Exceptions" filter is disabled by default.

Related:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3015#issuecomment-185403965
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/c676ceb7333eb43a1d9a95f9841901e7dbe929de

data.title: The name "Con" is not valid as a file or folder name
data.body:
I was going to create a folder named `Console`, and I noticed that when I typed `Con` it gave an error saying I can't create a folder with the name `Con` (case insensitive). As you can see from the image, it isn't because there already is a folder named `Con`. I haven't come across this for other folder names yet though.

![vscode-file-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1571806/13499524/62f576bc-e124-11e5-9771-93553a9e0531.png)

data.title: [json] provide code assist for $schema
data.body: On Mac OS X El Capitan, I tried to author a new JSON document, using the new ARM extension for Visual Studio Code. I'm not getting Intellisense suggestions for Azure Resource Manager resources. I'm assuming that the `$schema` property is required, but I'm not getting any assistance for how to add the schema version, or which schema versions are valid. Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell https://trevorsullivan.net https://twitter.com/pcgeek86

data.title: Git push hangs when remote requires credentials
data.body:
I'm working with an internal GitHub installation that requires me to add username & password with every push. In terminal this works fine, but in VS Code it I don't get any prompts and the operation hangs. I can continue to use VS Code, but not the Git features until I restart.

Here's a snippet of the Git output from VS Code.

```
git add -A -- .
git commit --quiet --allow-empty-message --file - --all
git show HEAD:gulpfile.js
git show HEAD:src/app/common/permissionSets.factory.js
git show HEAD:gulpfile.js
git show HEAD:src/app/common/permissionSets.factory.js
git push
```

data.title: Transfer Publishers in Marketplace
data.body:
Two questions that came up on [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ErichGamma/status/705309211736068096). 
1. Is it possible to transfer ownership? If not, can we get that added? 
2. How to add multiple users to a publisher account? 

I'm reaching out to the marketplace friends to find out the answer.

- F5

=> file is saved but for me debug does not start. When I hit F5 again it works.

data.title: API: output.show() no longer supports ViewColumn
data.body: But we still have it in our API.

data.title: Debugger will not hit typescript breakpoints on windows when the path contains spaces
data.body:
We had some team members who could not debug mocha unit-tests and others who could. We tracked the problem down to the path which contained spaces (in our case c:\development next\frontend) . This is probably also the cause of issues #3144 and #3659.

This issue has appeared in the last month, before that, we did not have problems with spaces in the path. We suspect that something is wrong with reading the sourcemaps.

data.title: Killing a debug session does not cancel Variable spinners
data.body: Whenever there is a long running debug adapter request and a spinner appears in the UI, this spinner does not disappear when the session is terminated (in fact the full variables viewlet does not disappear in this case). Since starting a new debug session does not work in this situation, only a window reload helps.

data.title: Column select doesn't work in read only files
data.body:
- Open the user settings. 
- Column select in the left editor `Default Settings`

I cannot select columns, but I can select ranges.

data.title: Duplicate identifier 'p0' error in JSDOC comments
GitHub Desktop not recognized by Visual Studio Code
data.body:
Hi am using GitHub Desktop on my Windows Machines because it is the easiest way to interact with GitHub especially if you work with multiple tools changing files in a repo.

Now VS Code is not recognizing the installed GitHub Desktop and wants me to install git-scm again. This is already there otherwise GitHub Desktop wouldn't work with GUI or GIT Shell.
What am I doing wrong in this case ? I found that others have issues too, but they seem related to authentication, I am stuck at having VS Code recognizing the setup :)

The installation of GitHub Desktop was done using Chocolatery, if this changes something.

Somehow Related topics I already read through but didn't make any difference.
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2947
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1984
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/32639393/authentication-failed-on-the-git-remote
- https://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/vstudio/en-US/eb6853f3-b710-4be5-8b82-d55fa568e2b9/problem-with-git-on-vs-code?forum=vsarch

It current autocompletes on import clauses too. Which is not desired.

data.title: Can no longer break in Unit tests using Code
data.body:
I am trying to break in a test using Code and it does not work anymore. I am on Mac and add a breakpoint to fileService.test.ts#421 (test watchFileChanges).

The breakpoint is not hit but the tests seem to execute:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/13487373/af0d1e70-e119-11e5-993e-84c57835e093.png)

data.title: Configure selector keys for suggest widget
data.body:
Whenever suggest widget (e.g. a completion list) is summoned (by a configured trigger character, e.g. `.` or `>`), both Tab and Enter are valid for selection by default. More than once I've accidentally accepted the suggestion rather than doing a line break as intended.

https://github.com/mitaki28/vscode-clang/issues/8 is a good example of this where a `completionProvider` is configured and triggered by `>`, causing issues when trying to do a line break:
![](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1016104/13473657/4b754dec-e088-11e5-8aa3-35e09aee946a.png)

At first I thought I'd suggest that the default should be only Tab to avoid all of this. But then I came to think that perhaps more ideally this should be configurable by the extension that registers a provider with `triggerCharacters`. What do you think?

data.title: TypeScript Definition File Download Error
data.body:
When I click on the light bulb appearing beside 'XX' keyword in my code, It has the option to download the type definition file XX.d.ts. But, when I click on it, it fails with the following message:

[Info] Unable to fetch d.ts file at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/borisyankov/DefinitelyTyped/master/XX/XX.d.ts: {1}

It appears that this part of the URL has been changed:
borisyankov -> DefinitelyTyped

data.title: Focus is inconsistent opacity in High Contrast theme
Limit callstack walking for stop-all debug adapters
data.body:
From earlier conversation with Andre

We’ve run into a limitation with the threading support in vscode for the C++ and C# debugging efforts that the diagnostics team is working on. Specifically, the current callstack window will only walk a thread if a stopped event for that thread has been sent. This makes sense as it appears the design is currently optimized for the stop one thread model (where only the thread that hit a bp or experienced another stopping event actually stops). 

However, both of these engines (C++ and C#) operate in the stop all mode where a single stopping event implies that all threads (or runtime in the case of C#) are stopped. 

While we could work around this by sending a stopped event for all threads in the process, the end result is vscode will ask us to walk the callstack for all threads in the process at each stopping event. Callstack walking has been one of the major sources of performance issues in the visual studio debugger on these runtimes, and in that case, we typically only walk the stack of a single thread, so we feel this will wind up being an issue with the vscode integrated debuggers as well. 

What we would like to propose would be to allow a debug adapter to enable  stop all mode so that stopped events for the other threads is implied and limiting the callstack request coming from the ui to only the threads that actually have their callstacks open in the thread’s window or whose frames are requested by debugger service in the ui.

data.title: Use local version of gulp in build steps
data.body:
Previously developers had to install gulp globally on their machine to build the project. These changes changes that by using the already locally installed version of gulp, removing the environment requirements aswell as ensuring everyone are using the same version of gulp.

It fixes the VS Code build tasks, aswell as creating a npm script to trigger the watch task:

``` bash
$ npm run watch
```
